intro: Cineraria sebaldii, commonly known as the Sebald's cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers range from white to pinkish in color. Cineraria sebaldii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
